snippet: The agency’s director will urge lawmakers to spend $8 million for a “realistic” facility to train those assigned to protect the president’s home.
abstract: Secret Service Dir Joseph P Clancy is asking lawmakers fund construction of detailed White House replica at training site in Beltsville, Md, in order to aid in training officers and agents to protect real thing; request follows several embarrassments at agency, including multiple intruder breaches of White House fence.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s director will urge lawmakers to spend $8 million for a “realistic” facility to train those assigned to protect the president’s home.

headline.main: Secret Service Wants a Fake White House to Help Protect the Real One
headline.print_headline: Stand-In White House Proposed for Training
